item.title: DSA - Sliding Window
item.description: What is the sliding window technique? The sliding window technique is a common algorithmic approach used to create a fixed-sized window that moves through the data one step at a time, typically from left to right, to perform specific operations or computations on the elements within the window. What is the sliding window algorithm? The sliding window algorithm is a method for finding a subset of elements that satisfy certain conditions in a given problem.
